\"Sabrina\", \"family\": \"Garcia\"}, {\"given\": \"Jamal\", \"family\": \"Moss\"}, {\"given\": \"Mark\", \"family\": \"Saunders\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2023\", \"04\", \"21\"]}], \"abstract\": \"Ce jeu de donn\u00e9es regroupe toutes les donn\u00e9es relatives aux exp\u00e9ditions en haute mer de l'Ann\u00e9e internationale du saumon, aux prises au chalut, aux mesures des sp\u00e9cimens, \u00e0 l'abondance du zooplancton et aux ensembles de donn\u00e9es CTD qui ont \u00e9t\u00e9 collect\u00e9s en mer en 2019 \u00e0 bord du Professor Kaganovsky, en 2020 \u00e0 bord du Pacific Legacy NO.1 et en 2022 \u00e0 bord du NGCC Sir John Franklin, NOAA Bell M. Shimada, R/V TINRO et R/V Northwest Explorer. Ces donn\u00e9es couvrent une grande partie de l'oc\u00e9an Pacifique Nord-Est et ont \u00e9t\u00e9 collect\u00e9es afin de mieux comprendre les conditions oc\u00e9aniques auxquelles le saumon est confront\u00e9 en hiver et la fa\u00e7on dont cela peut influencer la survie du saumon en haute mer.\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"North Pacific Anadromous Fish Commission\", \"title\": \"Collecte int\u00e9gr\u00e9e de donn\u00e9es issues des exp\u00e9ditions en haute mer de l'Ann\u00e9e internationale du saumon\", \"version\": \"4\", \"DOI\": \"10.21966/81jn-6p63\", \"language\": \"fr\", \"URL\": \"https://iys.hakai.org/dataset/ca-cioos_89c1b0c1-b358-4c0f-9fa9-467566c2ae69?local=fr\"}]

\"Weitkamp\"}, {\"given\": \"Chrys\", \"family\": \"Neville\"}, {\"given\": \"Aleksey\", \"family\": \"Somov\"}, {\"given\": \"Jackie\", \"family\": \"King\"}, {\"given\": \"Ed\", \"family\": der Stap\"}, {\"given\": \"Brett\", \"family\": \"Johnson\"}, {\"given\": \"Kirill\", \"family\": \"Kivva\"}, {\"given\": \"Svetlana\", \"family\": \"Esenkulova\"}, {\"given\": \"Shigehiko\", \"family\": \"Urawa\"}, {\"given\": \"Charlie\", \"family\": \"Waters\"}, {\"given\": \"Anna\", \"family\": \"Vazhova\"}, {\"given\": \"Vladimir\", \"family\": \"Radchenko\"}, {\"given\": \"Brian\", \"family\": \"Riddel\"}, {\"given\": \"Richard\", \"family\": \"Beamish\"}, {\"given\": \"Gennady\", \"family\": \"Kantakov\"}, {\"given\": \"Hae\", \"family\": \"Kun Jung\"}, {\"given\": \"Igor\", \"family\": \"Shurpa\"}, {\"given\": \"Arkadii\", \"family\": \"Ivanov\"}, {\"given\": \"Rebecca\", \"family\": \"LaForge\"}, {\"given\": \"Natalie\", \"family\": \"Mahara\"}, {\"given\": \"Jacob\", \"family\": \"Lerner\"}, {\"given\": \"Andrew\", \"family\": \"Dimond\"}, {\"given\": \"Denis\", \"family\": \"Chulchekov\"}, {\"given\": \"Katherine\", \"family\": \"Howard\"}, {\"given\": \"Sabrina\", \"family\": \"Garcia\"}, {\"given\": \"Jamal\", \"family\": \"Moss\"}, {\"given\": \"Mark\", \"family\": \"Saunders\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2023\", \"04\", \"21\"]}], \"abstract\": \"This dataset is a collection of all of the International Year of the Salmon High Seas Expeditions trawl catch, specimen measurements, zooplankton abundance, and CTD datasets that were collected at sea in 2019 aboard the Professor Kaganovsky, 2020 on the Pacific Legacy NO.1, and 2022 aboard the CCGS Sir John Franklin, NOAA Bell M. Shimada, R/V TINRO, and R/V Northwest Explorer. These data span much of the North East Pacific Ocean and were collected to better our understanding of the ocean conditions salmon experience during winter and how that may drive high seas salmon survival.\n\nNOTE: This dataset is not publicly available yet. If you are a IYS Expedition Participant, you must first submit your GitHub username to iys.data@hakai.org so that you can be given permission to access this data. Use of this dataset while it is only internally available to IYS Participants is subject to the IYS Data Policy available at: https://international-year-of-the-salmon.github.io/about/Final%20IYS%20Data%20Policy_Dec132021.pdf\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"North Pacific Anadromous Fish Commission\", \"title\": \"Integrated Data Collection from the International Year of the Salmon High Seas Expeditions\", \"version\": \"4\", \"DOI\": \"10.21966/81jn-6p63\", \"language\": \"en\", \"URL\": \"https://iys.hakai.org/dataset/ca-cioos_89c1b0c1-b358-4c0f-9fa9-467566c2ae69?local=en\"}]

      <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>This dataset is a collection of all of the International Year of the Salmon High Seas Expeditions trawl catch, specimen measurements, zooplankton abundance, and CTD datasets that were collected at sea in 2019 aboard the Professor Kaganovsky, 2020 on the Pacific Legacy NO.1, and 2022 aboard the CCGS Sir John Franklin, NOAA Bell M. Shimada, R/V TINRO, and R/V Northwest Explorer. These data span much of the North East Pacific Ocean and were collected to better our understanding of the ocean conditions salmon experience during winter and how that may drive high seas salmon survival.

NOTE: This dataset is not publicly available yet. If you are a IYS Expedition Participant, you must first submit your GitHub username to iys.data@hakai.org so that you can be given permission to access this data. Use of this dataset while it is only internally available to IYS Participants is subject to the IYS Data Policy available at: https://international-year-of-the-salmon.github.io/about/Final%20IYS%20Data%20Policy_Dec132021.pdf</gco:CharacterString>
        <lan:PT_FreeText>
          <lan:textGroup>
            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="#fr">Ce jeu de données regroupe toutes les données relatives aux expéditions en haute mer de l'Année internationale du saumon, aux prises au chalut, aux mesures des spécimens, à l'abondance du zooplancton et aux ensembles de données CTD qui ont été collectés en mer en 2019 à bord du Professor Kaganovsky, en 2020 à bord du Pacific Legacy NO.1 et en 2022 à bord du NGCC Sir John Franklin, NOAA Bell M. Shimada, R/V TINRO et R/V Northwest Explorer. Ces données couvrent une grande partie de l'océan Pacifique Nord-Est et ont été collectées afin de mieux comprendre les conditions océaniques auxquelles le saumon est confronté en hiver et la façon dont cela peut influencer la survie du saumon en haute mer.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>
          </lan:textGroup>
        </lan:PT_FreeText>
      </mri:abstract>

name: ca-cioos_89c1b0c1-b358-4c0f-9fa9-467566c2ae691
notes:
This dataset is a collection of all of the International Year of the Salmon High Seas Expeditions trawl catch, specimen measurements, zooplankton abundance, and CTD datasets that were collected at sea in 2019 aboard the Professor Kaganovsky, 2020 on the Pacific Legacy NO.1, and 2022 aboard the CCGS Sir John Franklin, NOAA Bell M. Shimada, R/V TINRO, and R/V Northwest Explorer. These data span much of the North East Pacific Ocean and were collected to better our understanding of the ocean conditions salmon experience during winter and how that may drive high seas salmon survival.

NOTE: This dataset is not publicly available yet. If you are a IYS Expedition Participant, you must first submit your GitHub username to iys.data@hakai.org so that you can be given permission to access this data. Use of this dataset while it is only internally available to IYS Participants is subject to the IYS Data Policy available at: https://international-year-of-the-salmon.github.io/about/Final%20IYS%20Data%20Policy_Dec132021.pdf

This dataset is a collection of all of the International Year of the Salmon High Seas Expeditions trawl catch, specimen measurements, zooplankton abundance, and CTD datasets that were collected at sea in 2019 aboard the Professor Kaganovsky, 2020 on the Pacific Legacy NO.1, and 2022 aboard the CCGS Sir John Franklin, NOAA Bell M. Shimada, R/V TINRO, and R/V Northwest Explorer. These data span much of the North East Pacific Ocean and were collected to better our understanding of the ocean conditions salmon experience during winter and how that may drive high seas salmon survival.

NOTE: This dataset is not publicly available yet. If you are a IYS Expedition Participant, you must first submit your GitHub username to iys.data@hakai.org so that you can be given permission to access this data. Use of this dataset while it is only internally available to IYS Participants is subject to the IYS Data Policy available at: https://international-year-of-the-salmon.github.io/about/Final%20IYS%20Data%20Policy_Dec132021.pdf
notes_translated.fr: Ce jeu de données regroupe toutes les données relatives aux expéditions en haute mer de l'Année internationale du saumon, aux prises au chalut, aux mesures des spécimens, à l'abondance du zooplancton et aux ensembles de données CTD qui ont été collectés en mer en 2019 à bord du Professor Kaganovsky, en 2020 à bord du Pacific Legacy NO.1 et en 2022 à bord du NGCC Sir John Franklin, NOAA Bell M. Shimada, R/V TINRO et R/V Northwest Explorer. Ces données couvrent une grande partie de l'océan Pacifique Nord-Est et ont été collectées afin de mieux comprendre les conditions océaniques auxquelles le saumon est confronté en hiver et la façon dont cela peut influencer la survie du saumon en haute mer.

description_translated.en: The Canadian Integrated Ocean Observing System (CIOOS) Pacific is the regional hub of the National CIOOS for ocean data aggregation on Canada’s west coast.
description_translated.fr: Le Système intégré d’observation des océans canadien (SIOOC) Pacifique est la plaque tournante régionale du SIOOC national pour l’agrégation des données océaniques sur la côte ouest du Canada.
